content: The theory of evolution by natural selection was proposed by Charles Darwin in his 1859 book 'On the Origin of Species'.
The Hubble Space Telescope has been in operation since 1990, providing unprecedented views of distant galaxies and nebulae.
Plate tectonics explains the movement of Earth's lithosphere, causing earthquakes, volcanic activity, and mountain formation.
The Rosetta Stone, discovered in 1799, was key to deciphering ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics.
Quantum mechanics describes the behavior of matter and energy at the atomic and subatomic scale.
The Wright brothers achieved the first powered flight on December 17, 1903, at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.
DNA replication is semiconservative, meaning each new DNA molecule contains one original strand and one newly synthesized strand.
The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the late 18th century, transforming manufacturing and society.
Photons are particles of light that exhibit both wave and particle properties, a concept known as wave-particle duality.
The Krebs cycle is a series of chemical reactions used by aerobic organisms to generate energy through oxidation of acetyl-CoA.
The Roman Empire reached its greatest extent under Emperor Trajan in 117 AD, spanning three continents.
Newton's laws of motion describe the relationship between force, mass, and acceleration in classical mechanics.
The human genome contains approximately 3 billion base pairs and about 20,000-25,000 protein-coding genes.
The Renaissance period in Europe, spanning the 14th to 17th centuries, saw a revival of art, culture, and learning.
Superconductors exhibit zero electrical resistance and perfect diamagnetism when cooled below a critical temperature.
The immune system uses specialized cells like T-cells and B-cells to identify and destroy pathogens.
The French Revolution began in 1789 with the storming of the Bastille, leading to major political and social changes.
Enzymes are biological catalysts that speed up chemical reactions in living organisms without being consumed.
The Big Bang theory describes the universe's origin from an extremely hot, dense state approximately 13.8 billion years ago.
Chlorophyll is the green pigment in plants that absorbs light energy for photosynthesis, primarily in the red and blue wavelengths.
